thresholds.name: Ashida body-width crossover ratio
thresholds.description: Body W:H ratio where Helmholtz stripe effect transitions from slimming to widening
thresholds.source: Interpolated from Thompson cylinder fade + Ashida midpoint (only 2 body sizes tested)

thresholds.name: Transition zone bounds
thresholds.description: Zone where stripe effect direction is unreliable; extremely high individual variability

thresholds.name: Full reversal onset
thresholds.description: Above this, horizontal stripes clearly widen and vertical stripes slim
thresholds.evidence: Imai 1982: overweight figure at W:H ~0.70-0.80 showed 15.37% reversal

thresholds.name: Transition steepness parameter
thresholds.description: Sigmoid steepness for body-width-dependent stripe scoring. Higher = sharper; lower = more gradual. Set to match observed high variability.

thresholds.name: Oppel-Kundt peak filler count
thresholds.description: Oppel-Kundt expansion peaks at this range then declines. Wackermann refined to 15-16 via functional fit.

thresholds.name: Duty cycle effect range
thresholds.description: Duty cycle 0.1 (thick lines) -> 4.1% effect; duty cycle 0.9 (narrow lines) -> 10.1%

thresholds.name: Comparison baseline reduction factor
thresholds.description: When comparing H-stripes to plain (not to V-stripes), effect reduced to 30%

thresholds.name: 3D vs 2D amplification multiplier
thresholds.description: 3D viewing amplifies stripe effect by 1.84x (10.7%/5.8%)

thresholds.name: L* slimming onset threshold
thresholds.description: Below this, slimming effect is measurable

thresholds.name: L* maximum slimming zone
thresholds.description: Below this (jet black), maximum slimming achieved. Going darker adds almost nothing.

thresholds.name: L* saturation asymptote
thresholds.description: Below L*~25, each additional unit of darkness adds <0.01% width change (diminishing returns)
thresholds.source: Koutsoumpis 2021: 37x luminance difference produced SMALLER effect than 2x

thresholds.name: Sigmoid midpoint
thresholds.description: L* value where luminance effect passes through zero

thresholds.name: Sigmoid steepness
thresholds.description: Controls transition sharpness of luminance scoring function

thresholds.name: Background multiplier gamma
thresholds.description: Non-linear background amplification exponent

thresholds.name: Background multiplier range
thresholds.description: White bg ~0.15 (near-zero effect); black bg ~3.15 (strong effect)

thresholds.name: Background amplification ratio (dark/light)
thresholds.description: Dark background amplifies luminance slimming 7x vs light background
thresholds.source: Koutsoumpis Exp 3: PSE 0.21 deg vs 0.03 deg

thresholds.name: Reference body width ratio
thresholds.description: W:H ratio used as reference for proportionality correction. Wider bodies get proportionally less benefit.

thresholds.name: Fabric sheen modifiers
thresholds.description: Multiplier on luminance slimming effect based on fabric surface properties

thresholds.name: Skin-garment contrast thresholds
thresholds.description: deltaL>60: boundary sharpened (+0.5-1.5% width). deltaL<30: boundary blends.

thresholds.name: Müller-Lyer optimal fin angle
thresholds.description: Maximum elongation (15-18% wings-out) occurs at ~30 degree fin angle

thresholds.name: Müller-Lyer null angle
thresholds.description: At 90 degrees, effect drops to zero. Any design element at perpendicular is neutral.

thresholds.name: V-neckline gap reversal threshold
thresholds.description: If V-neckline doesn't contact body (stands away by 8-18mm), assimilation-to-contrast shift can REVERSE ML illusion

thresholds.name: Deep V skin exposure widening threshold
thresholds.description: Exposed skin width >30% of body width: elongation cancelled. >40%: net widening.

thresholds.name: Shallow V null threshold
thresholds.description: Above 80 degree total V angle, approaches crew/scoop and ML drops to near zero

thresholds.name: Golden ratio target (default/Western)
thresholds.description: Optimal upper-to-lower body proportion (fraction from top for waist break)

thresholds.name: Golden ratio target (tall body adjustment)
thresholds.description: Tall women need break ABOVE GR to maintain long leg lines

thresholds.name: Golden ratio aesthetic effect size
thresholds.description: GR rated 6.71 vs equal division 6.45 on 10-pt scale = 2.6% of range. Barely perceptible.

thresholds.name: Attention-to-size conversion factor
thresholds.unit: percent size change per percent fixation shift

thresholds.name: Focal point strength threshold
thresholds.description: Focal point must exceed 0.3 strength to override baseline gaze

thresholds.name: Loose clothing gaze shift threshold
thresholds.unit: cm garment ease beyond body circumference
thresholds.description: Binary threshold where garment breaks free from body contour at waist-hip

thresholds.name: Vertical element count threshold for Oppel-Kundt reversal
thresholds.description: Below 4: HVI elongation (slimming). Above 8-12: Oppel-Kundt widening dominates.

thresholds.name: Frame effect HVI reduction
thresholds.description: Vertical lines within horizontal frame (standard garment) reduce HVI from 5-10% to ~1%

thresholds.name: Loose fit body-size crossover
thresholds.description: Above UK12-14: loose slims (-5-8%). Below UK6-8: loose widens (+2-4%). Between: neutral.

thresholds.name: Structured vs soft fabric fit modifiers
thresholds.description: Structured loose (blazer) creates engineered shape. Soft loose (jersey) partially reveals body.

thresholds.name: Asymmetric score anchors
thresholds.description: Score = pct/10.7 for slimming; pct/15.37 for widening. Asymmetric because reversal effects produce larger widening than any combination produces slimming.
